header: Cri.Bail Application no. 14/19 ORDER BELOW EXH.1

background.text: 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. No.314/18 registered at Sangvi Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354A, 506(2) of the Indian Penal Code, under section 12 & 18 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012, under section 4(25) of Indian Arms Act and under section 37(1), 135 of Mumbai Police Act.

arguments.text: It is alleged that mother of victim lodged report stating that on 15/12/2018 victim aged about 5 years was playing near public toilet in their area. When she returned to house, she was in frightened condition. Upon inquiry with her, she told that on previous day when she was playing near public toilet, applicant was in toilet in nude condition, he called her near him and showed his private part. Mother of victim went to house of applicant to ask him the reason of act. He showed sickle to mother of victim and threatened to kill her if complaint filed in police station.

argumentSentences.text: It is alleged that mother of victim lodged report stating that on 15/12/2018 victim aged about 5 years was playing near public toilet in their area.
When she returned to house, she was in frightened condition.
Upon inquiry with her, she told that on previous day when she was playing near public toilet, applicant was in toilet in nude condition, he called her near him and showed his private part.
Mother of victim went to house of applicant to ask him the reason of act.
He showed sickle to mother of victim and threatened to kill her if complaint filed in police station.

arguments.text: 3] According to applicant, he is falsely implicated in this matter. His family members are depending upon him. He is only earning member in his family. Investigation is practically over. He never misbehaved with victim. There is delay in lodging report. He is permanently residing at Aundh, Dist­Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] According to applicant, he is falsely implicated in this matter.
His family members are depending upon him.
He is only earning member in his family.
Investigation is practically over.
He never misbehaved with victim.
There is delay in lodging report.
He is permanently residing at Aundh, Dist­Pune.
He has no criminal antecedents.
He is ready to abide the conditions.
Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

arguments.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and 2 Cri.Bail Application no. 14/19 witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. Previously in Sangvi Police Station, offence p/u/s 376,323 & 506 of IPC is filed against applicant. So, they prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress.
Applicant will pressurize victim and 2 Cri.Bail Application no. 14/19 witnesses.
There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence.
Previously in Sangvi Police Station, offence p/u/s 376,323 & 506 of IPC is filed against applicant.
So, they prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is interrogated. Statements of most of the witnesses are recorded. Recovery is made. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is earning member of family and his family members are depending upon him. In respect of criminal antecedents, advocate of accused relied upon authority cited in the case of Maulana Mohammed Amir Rashadi Vs. State of U.P. reported in 2012(2) Mh.L.J.(Cri.) 412 in which it is observed that merely on the basis of criminal antecedents, bail cannot be denied. While considering the application for grant of bail, it is duty of the court to find out the role of the accused in the case in which he has been charged and other circumstances such as possibility of fleeing away from the jurisdiction of the court. Ratio laid down in above citation is noted. Applicant is resident of Aundh Pune. Moreover, investigation is almost over. Therefore, only on the ground of criminal antecedents, it is not proper to deny the bail. If strict conditions are imposed it will suffice the purpose Therefore, application deserves to be allowed with following order:

argumentSentences.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious.
Applicant is interrogated.
Statements of most of the witnesses are recorded.
Recovery is made.
Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over.
Personal custody of applicant is not required.
Applicant is earning member of family and his family members are depending upon him.
In respect of criminal antecedents, advocate of accused relied upon authority cited in the case of Maulana Mohammed Amir Rashadi Vs. State of U.P. reported in 2012(2) Mh.L.J.
(Cri.)
412 in which it is observed that merely on the basis of criminal antecedents, bail cannot be denied.

While considering the application for grant of bail, it is duty of the court to find out the role of the accused in the case in which he has been charged and other circumstances such as possibility of fleeing away from the jurisdiction of the court.
Ratio laid down in above citation is noted.
Applicant is resident of Aundh Pune.
Moreover, investigation is almost over.
Therefore, only on the ground of criminal antecedents, it is not proper to deny the bail.
If strict conditions are imposed it will suffice the purpose Therefore, application deserves to be allowed with following order:

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Umesh @ Pappu Ravindra Sarkaniya be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.50,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties 3 Cri.Bail Application no. 14/19 in the like amount. Local surety be furnished and surety be verified by police. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution evidence in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Sangvi Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not harass, meet victim and threat and pressurize the victim or first informant and witnesses. 6] Applicant shall not repeat offence and shall not enter in the vicinity of residence of victim. 7] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 8] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number.

footer: sd/­­ Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date –22.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. 4 Cri.Bail Application no. 14/19 “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ S.V.Thakar, Court Name ­ Smt. R.V.Adone, Addl.Sessions Judge,Pune. Date of Order ­ 22.01.2019. processedText:
Cri.Bail Application no. 14/19 ORDER BELOW EXH.1 
---header-ends---
1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. No.314/18 registered at Sangvi Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354A, 506(2) of the Indian Penal Code, under section 12 & 18 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012, under section 4(25) of Indian Arms Act and under section 37(1), 135 of Mumbai Police Act.
---background-ends---
It is alleged that mother of victim lodged report stating that on 15/12/2018 victim aged about 5 years was playing near public toilet in their area. When she returned to house, she was in frightened condition. Upon inquiry with her, she told that on previous day when she was playing near public toilet, applicant was in toilet in nude condition, he called her near him and showed his private part. Mother of victim went to house of applicant to ask him the reason of act. He showed sickle to mother of victim and threatened to kill her if complaint filed in police station. 
---argument-ends---
3] According to applicant, he is falsely implicated in this matter. His family members are depending upon him. He is only earning member in his family. Investigation is practically over. He never misbehaved with victim. There is delay in lodging report. He is permanently residing at Aundh, Dist­Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and 2 Cri.Bail Application no. 14/19 witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. Previously in Sangvi Police Station, offence p/u/s 376,323 & 506 of IPC is filed against applicant. So, they prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is interrogated. Statements of most of the witnesses are recorded. Recovery is made. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is earning member of family and his family members are depending upon him. In respect of criminal antecedents, advocate of accused relied upon authority cited in the case of Maulana Mohammed Amir Rashadi Vs. State of U.P. reported in 2012(2) Mh.L.J.(Cri.) 412 in which it is observed that merely on the basis of criminal antecedents, bail cannot be denied. While considering the application for grant of bail, it is duty of the court to find out the role of the accused in the case in which he has been charged and other circumstances such as possibility of fleeing away from the jurisdiction of the court. Ratio laid down in above citation is noted. Applicant is resident of Aundh Pune. Moreover, investigation is almost over. Therefore, only on the ground of criminal antecedents, it is not proper to deny the bail. If strict conditions are imposed it will suffice the purpose Therefore, application deserves to be allowed with following order: 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Umesh @ Pappu Ravindra Sarkaniya be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.50,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties 3 Cri.Bail Application no. 14/19 in the like amount. Local surety be furnished and surety be verified by police. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution evidence in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Sangvi Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not harass, meet victim and threat and pressurize the victim or first informant and witnesses. 6] Applicant shall not repeat offence and shall not enter in the vicinity of residence of victim. 7] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 8] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number. 
---order-ends---
sd/­­ Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date –22.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. 4 Cri.Bail Application no. 14/19 “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F.
